pullRequest.body:
Definition of separated morphisms.

---

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

Stability properties are in the pipeline but depend on a sequence of PRs on closed immersions.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9460742323/job/26060103902)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9460742323/job/26060104469)

```suggestion

attribute [instance] IsSeparated.diagonalClosedImmersion

```

```suggestion
instance (priority := 900) {X Y : Scheme} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) [IsSeparated f] : QuasiSeparated f where
```
Changed. I am seeing this in a lot of places: why do we need this or why is it advisable?

Because lean finds type classes in reverse. It sees that the goal is `QuasiSeparated f` and it lists all instances with goals looking like that and tries it one by one. Usually `f` is some complex term whose structure gives instances (for example `QuasiSeparated f -> QuasiSeparated (pullback f g)`), and instances with generic goals (i.e. `f` is a variable) should be tried last.
There's a note [lower instance priority] for this.

Untested, but this should make some definitions below more automatic:
```suggestion
  diagonalClosedImmersion : IsClosedImmersion (pullback.diagonal f) := by infer_instance
```
The same could be done to `QuasiSeparated`.
Done

```suggestion
instance (priority := 900) separated_of_mono [Mono f] :
```

```suggestion
class IsSeparated : Prop where
```

```suggestion
instance (priority := 900) [IsSeparated f] : QuasiSeparated f where
```
